website_summaries.verdict: A lower-priced option from a well-known brand. It's small and easy to store, but it could be difficult to use for those with larger hands/fingers.
pros: Quick setup and long battery life
Keys are responsive and have a great movement to them
cons: The keys are not back-lit, and the spacing could prove difficult for those who type frequently

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Unifying....
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a keyboard mouse combo, but it is very annoying for one specific reason. UNIFYING... I purchased a K360 last year that works great and has the orange Unifying logo on it. This "version" has no orange logo and does not pair with Unifying receivers. That is a bit of an annoyance as the images for the device show a Unifying receiver and they use the term Unifying in the description. BEWARE. I've included an image of the 2 K360s side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Spatch359

customer_reviews.title: Bought another one for work...Dang NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had it long, but Dang NICE! To start off, it is encrypted. It looks great, it connected in 1/2 second, it is a great size (slightly smaller, but good), and it feels great. I've tried a lot of different keyboards. As a writer, I have tossed a lot to the side, but so far, this is a great keyboard. And the cost? You can't do better. At 15$, I can order a spare, but I don't think I will need to:) Logitech for mice and keyboards! YEAH!
customer_reviews.author: W. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great! I love this item!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love it. Battery life is outstanding, it feels great in your finger and you can use it from across the classroom. It looks nice on the desk, takes up very little space and is easy to carry in my laptop bag. I simply loved the usb wireless connector being saved inside the keyboard in a non visible place. You can't lose it. Superb!!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Does not include the Unifying technology !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the Logitech K360 keyboard I was expecting. Is this a knockoff? Texture on keyboard is different. It is not a Logitech Unifying product. The keyboard is responsive to the touch. The mouse (M185) is compact and the school wheel has very slight click to click mode (not as distinct as other Logitech mice). The last two K360 keyboards I have bought had the Logitech Unifying technology. This one does not. I purchased because my other K360 keyboards as so nice and I can pair them with what ever logitech unifying devices i want to use. This keyboard and mouse do not allow that kind of freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear of this one
customer_reviews.text: The tracking a latency of this keyboard and mouse is so bad, I am just going to put it directly in the trash. The problem may be the USB receiver, because I plugged in a different Logitech keyboard with a different (unified) receiver, and it works perfectly. In addition, everything about this set feels really cheap and just too light weight. The mouse is too small and just kind of gets lost in your hand. My advice is to spend a little more for a more robust product.
customer_reviews.author: Otis Stelly

customer_reviews.title: Missed Keystrokes from 8", No NUM lock light, STAY AWAY!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nearly unusable. MANY MANY MANY missed keystrokes from less than 10 inches away. Had I not thrown the packaging away, I would return this keyboard, totally useless. Only had it 5 days. I have attempted to use this with different batteries, 4 different unifying receivers, etc. Currently I am typing on this keypad and it works when it feels like it. PROs: Nice firm feel of the keys Dimensions of keyboard work well when traveling. Function keys/shortcuts are nice on this small keypad CONs: MANY missed keystrokes No lights to know if Num Lock is on/off Sorry Logitech, first product I have purchased from you that is a TOTAL loss, right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: JBDekes

customer_reviews.title: Constant disconnects and terrible typing experience.
customer_reviews.text: I gave up on this keyboard because it's connection constantly had terrible lag that made it unusable, like every 30 seconds it was renegotiating with the dongle. You would be in the middle of a sentence and letters would stop appearing, you'd stop and usually they'd appear 30 seconds or so later. Or maybe they wouldn't... so you have to wait for it to catch up every time as you never knew what it was going to do. Unusable
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: built like a TANK!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this keyboard for 5 years and 3 months and still working flawlessly. I've been using this thing HEAVILY for all that time and the only keys that got the paint peeled off were the volume buttons. the paint is made from vibranium or something, man.. dropped it several times, no problem either. about two battery changes a year with heavy use. I can't believe a 20$ keyboard would be so durable. this keyboard is AMAZING. not so good for gaming though because this keyboard doesn't have anti ghosting, but for normal use and casual gaming this thing is rock solid. can't recommend this little keyboard enough. <3 logitech
customer_reviews.author: Punpun

customer_reviews.title: Horrible typing experience
customer_reviews.text: The keys are loud, stiff, sticky, and small. Its way worse than the factory keyboard I received with my desktop. I'm trying to find a near silent full size keyboard. If anyone knows of the best one that meets these requirements let me know. I have been doing a LOT of searching and I guess the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It is broken just 5 month using
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has lag so much. It is only 5 month when I buy. I don't know what's wrong and contacted with logitech. Logitech support gave me a solutions but all didn't work. The keyboard lag is happened occasionally. Sometime is fine but it happen suddenly. I can't use it any more and Logitech didn't want to RMA. I decide to waste this keyboard and mouse in trash can. Don't buy this devices. It is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Youngho Lee

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: First of all, letmetalkabout the keyboard. I like the somewhat flat keys but there is a BIG problem. Notice how there is no spacing in my words "letmetalkabout?" It is not that I didn't hit the spacebar as I type, it is just that it very often DOES NOT register. (I am going through my review to make adjustments because most of the words are joined together without spacing despite hitting the spacebar.) It is VERY annoying! And as to the mouse. I seem to have to click multiple times before the computer responds. It is VERY frustrating. I love wireless but this set-up of the keyboard and mouse is awful. DON"T BUY IT unless you enjoy massive frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Stein

customer_reviews.title: A great DEAL
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love here? Nice, light weight, sleek looking wireless keyboard that has hit every mark so far. The mouse works great as well, no complaints there. The keyboard has all the keys I need, that my surface keyboard does not. It really comes in handy when you just need the feel of a real physical keyboard. Definitely adds to efficiency. One of the better deals on Amazon, that's for sure. I would recommend 100% of the time
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard and mouse to replace an exact keyboard that has hit the floor one time too many. It's a great wireless keyboard. The mouse is a different matter. Unfortunately it has minimal features, no forward or back buttons needed if you do any Web associated work. The keyboard is small and light and sits well in your lap. It will take a lot of punishment and keep working. My last one lasted at least 5 years and is still working, even as many times as it has been knocked over and dropped. I give it an A+++ rating. Besides Logitech makes some great input devices.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months, several keys on keyboard not working
customer_reviews.text: Died after 4 months. Several of the keys on the keyboard stopped working. What good is a 3 year battery life if the life of the keyboard is 4 months! The keyboard wasn't that comfortable when it was working. The smaller form factor/compressed layout was less convenient for heavy typing, and very annoying for gaming. Sure you can easily get used to it but if it's annoying switching between different style keyboards from computer to computer. The mouse works great... I guess I have a $20 mouse now. I'm totally bummed. I'm usually a fan of Logitech and use their keyboards and mouses exclusively, but this product is total rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Has Consistent Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: My wife has the same keyboard and I really like hers. However, when I ordered this one I thought it would be the same. They are NOT the same. They both are supposedly the Logitech K360 but the one I ordered looks a little different and is constantly dropping it's signal. The back of them are not the same either. I believe one other reviewer found the similar issue, so just look at his pictures. I believe this must be a Chinese knockoff. Open your eyes Amazon. I wish I had returned it earlier cause now my window for returning is over. Into the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hartfeld

customer_reviews.title: Good look and feel, horrible connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of Logitech products and generally liked them but his keyboard has serious connectivity issues. It often takes minutes to connect and seems to work a little better if the keyboarders/mouse is less than 12" away from the receiver. If the Keyboard or mouse in more than 2 feet away from the receiver then they often will not connect at all and even when they do it takes several minutes. I would gladly have paid twice as much for the same product but a much better connectivity experience.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lobdell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job if you wan keep the keyboard and mouse with one foot of unobstructed distance
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, it does the job. The ergonomics are very straightforward. The batteries last for ages. The wireless connection is as frustrating as with any other combo i have tried so far: it works well if the keyboard and mouse are one foot away from the transmitter and if there really is nothing in between. The transmitter really needs to be on the front panel or an USB hub otherwise it will be patchy and really frustrating to use. Also, any electronic device in close proximity is likely to cause some interference (e.g. a phone next to the mouse)
customer_reviews.author: come raczy

customer_reviews.title: nice combo
customer_reviews.text: +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++my wife has had this set for years. it hold up well is easy on batteries and just works very smoothly. nice set for cheap price it feels very nice. I am a gamer with a gaming rig ,gaming keyboard and gaming mouse. I use this set on the side on my regular pc i have set up . You would not want to game with this . Because the lag would make you miss a lot. (lag in Milliseconds) as for normal use this set is great
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Very poor connection to computer
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty well for the first few days, but by the second week (today) it essentially stopped working. Yesterday I noticed it'd miss a key here and there, and by the end of the day, a lot of keypresses were not registering. I thought it might be the batteries, so I replaced them with brand new batteries, and it did not fix the problem. I tried resetting my computer, and it still did not work. It seems to have to do with the connection between the keyboard and the receiver. (This is on a 2 week old 15" MacBook Pro)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, Ok mouse, Ads are misleading
customer_reviews.text: - I love the keyboard -- Super slim fit but still feels like a full size keyboard -- The switches are membrane but have a nice switch imitation to them -- no back lighting...but I knew that -- came with the K360 model -- DOES NOT SUPPORT UNIFYING DONGLE - Mouse is ok -- It functions and is responsive in a congested 2.4GHz environment -- A bit small came with M185 model -- DOES NOT SUPPORT UNIFYING DONGLE - There is only one dongle that is paired with both devices but its not their new unifying version
customer_reviews.author: Aron and Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I would never get a glossy black one again. It shows every fingerprint and is difficult to clean and keep clean. Previously I had a different Logitech model wireless keyboard with a matte finish and it was much better. Other than that I am pleased with its performance. However, the three year battery life was not true in my case. I only use my keyboard for about three hours a day and always turn it off when not in use. The original batteries that came installed with this lasted about two months. Hopefully the new batteries that I just installed will last a lot longer. I'll have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: RC Hoppy

customer_reviews.title: Might not work with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this keyboard you have to go to Logitech updates for this keyboard to be able to program the 12 Function keys. After installing and opening this program there is a notice that this might not work with Windows 10. WONDERFUL - why is this not on the description? I spoke to Amazon and a return was emailed to me. Needless to say this piece of @*&%$# is being returned tomorrow morning. Also, a Logitech support tech was on the phone with me for almost 2 hours trying to get it to work. He told me it must be defective. Think twice before deciding to buy this. - Bobby Blue
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Blue

customer_reviews.title: We have owned two of these keyboards. The first ...
customer_reviews.text: We have owned two of these keyboards. The first one died in 8 months; the second died in 6 months. The batteries we used were fresh and worked in other electronics but not in this keyboard. Happens suddenly without warning. Logitech makes the warranty process a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Carrot Garden

customer_reviews.title: It's a Logitech, it always works.
customer_reviews.text: Every Logitech wireless keyboard I had used always responds to the very first key stroke, no matter how long since used last. No, I never turn it off, yet the batteries last a year or more. Lessor keyboards must be woken up to function, you lose the first few keystrokes...annoying! These Logitech keyboards work as reliably as a corded keyboard. The reception range is also great. I use mine across a large room. The size of this model is convenient, previous ones were a bit bulky. Overall I am thrilled with this keyboard. Cheaper keyboards can not compare.
customer_reviews.author: misfitsailor

customer_reviews.title: They've gone to pot!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Logitech products for decades, and more so in the past 14 years since their products don't reek of chemicals and cause me serious allergic reactions. But all of a sudden I had to replace my portable keyboard 4 times last year when they used to last more than a year. And I wasn't using them any more than usual. It's a shame, and not just because I hate the prospect of trying to a new keyboard and other peripherals provider, but because I'd rather keep giving my old pal Logitech my money...but not when the resulting price is more than 4x what it used to be!!
customer_reviews.author: 3-5 book a week habit

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Darndest thing I ever saw. This keyboard was doing it's usual thing of ignoring the keys I typed or making me wait for about 10-15 seconds then displaying the latter half of what I typed, when all of the sudden it jumped up and smashed itself over my knee. 3 years of me waiting patiently for it to respond and for no reason it committed suicide. I don't want to witness this again, so I think I'll buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Just Honest

customer_reviews.title: cheap plastic parts break
customer_reviews.text: overall the unit works well. keyboard and mouse don’t lose connection or anything like that. i’ve had this for some months now and it still has the first batteries in it. my disappointment is with the parts that you can use to put the keyboard at an angle. the two plastic pieces under the keyboard. like a “stand” i suppose. one of those has broken as you can see in the picture. so that breaks the whole function. manufacturers should include extra cheap pieces like this if they are known to break easily. i haven’t checked yet to see if they sell replacements but it’s such a minor hassle that no one should have to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Great compact keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of desk space and I love this keyboard. I love it so much I've purchased two - one for my home office and one for when I work at a client's location on their laptop. While not an ergonomic design, they are space saving and the distance between the QWERTY and 10-key is minimal - so if you use the 10-key a lot, this might be a nice time saver for you. Obviously, I'd buy these again :)
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very seldom do I rate something a 5 star. However, I am rating this keyboard and mouse a 5 because: *The key spacing is great *The feel and function of the keys are excellent *The entire keyboard fits in a small computer bag *It's lightweight *The 10 key is a bonus on this size keyboard Simply put, you couldn't ask for a better keyboard for portability and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I bought it for!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for what I bought it for - which is to use w/the new smart flatscreen I purchased. The tv accesses the internet, and I stream most of my tv from an independent (not hulu, amazon or netflix) site that requires alot of moving the cursor/pointer around. The mouse has made my life soooo much better. The keyboard is nice too, as I no longer have to 'hunt & peck' with the clicker, moving the cursor one space at a time when typing a command is needed anywhere in the operation of the tv - like entering passwords & such. This is a really nice size and stashes beside the recliner really well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Ann Oniya

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is cordless, although I'm not a cordless 'freak.' I really like that I can turn the keyboard on and off. Sometimes, I want to read a book or something and it tends to lie a bit on the keyboard. I can just shut it off. I also like that I can turn the volume up, down, or off via 3 keyboard buttons. That's pretty neat. The only improvement I would make is to have a light on the "Num Lock" key, so that it is easy to tell when the Num Lock is on or off. I would buy again at the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: DLSKC

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is by no means a poor keyboard for $20. It works well, and the wireless is solid. My reservations in recommending this device are related to key design and placement. This is a bizarre semi-chiclet membrane keyboard, which translates to high finger impact with each stroke, higher rate of missed keystrokes, and irritating gaps between keys. This is not a good keyboard for high volume typing, given these reasons. I do not consider it an ergonomic device, so office users beware. Given the price and reliability, it's a good portable keyboard for infrequent use. Otherwise, consider a more standard key setup, or a split keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ninazu

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for one day.
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked fine out of the box but started having problems with the mouse intermittently dropping out after about one or two days. It got worse and worse until both keyboard and mouse became unresponsive. Fortunately, I had a backup keyboard and mouse. I like the keyboard layout and the mouse feels fine in hand and so I have initiated an exchange. Changed mind and canceled the exchange. Sent defective order back (they provided shipping). After, I realized that I failed to check for driver updates - which could possibly have fixed the problem. Maybe, coulda' woulda' shoulda'. Remember to check for updates.
customer_reviews.author: bighatnohorse

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a quiet keyboard and mouse. In fact, the mouse buttons are VERY loud.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compact keyboard and mouse setup for when I am in meetings taking notes. The keyboard is quiet; you can still hear the keys tapping but difficult to hear especially if someone is talking. The mouse on the other hand is ridiculously loud. The button clicks are so loud that it would be a disruption to a person speaking. I don't understand how we can put a man on the moon but we can't make a keyboard and mouse combo that is quiet. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kingdom of Geek

customer_reviews.title: Works and lasts
customer_reviews.text: I have two 12 year old All In One Computers that are used everyday. In 12 years I have gone through 3 sets of Keyword/Mice combos; the original, and 2 replacements from the maker of the computer. I bought the first Logitech Keyboard/Mouse about 4 years ago. The second one last this year. The logitech product lasts. The one of 4 years ago is still working as it did when new. I expect this new one will last as well. Battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: mkremer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Although I like the compact design if the keyboard and the ergonomics of the mouse I am more than disappointed that the mouse starts to malfunction after only 6 months of use. Unless you find the exact point to push on the mouse's left button it does not perform its functions, which it did without problems when new. This is the second mouse I encountered this issue with, the other one lasted a bit longer than this one. I expected more and will think twice if I buy a Logitech mouse (and with that probably the combo) again.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas T Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's not big and clunky, in fact it's small and compact. I love the size of this keyboard AND that it has the number pad on the right hand side. Zero problems typing on this keyboard. It's lightweight so if I am leaning back or elsewhere with the keyboard I can easily move it. The only issue I had was the rubber gripping on the bottom of the keyboard slipped and fell off but I glued it back on and had no problems since. This probably won't even happen if you don't move your keyboard off the desk. Out of all the 'deluxe' and superior keyboards, I would choose this one over them any day.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: NOT Logitech Unifying Receiver compatible
customer_reviews.text: Why would a company put out a product like this EVER? I have several Logitech keyboards and mice at home and work. All wireless, and they all work seamlessly together. Move from one computer to the other by using the Logitech Unifying software. Someone decided to make a K360 with a different USB receiver. ATTN: Logitech product managers: DO NOT DO THIS again. One strike. Two and you're out. I am one of those people that if a corporation angers me enough, I will ban them for life. I love Logitech products. Do not go down this road ripping your customers off like this. Recall this version and don't play games with your life long customers.
customer_reviews.author: Kenta

customer_reviews.title: Lagging and bad connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard based on the previous reviews (all 5-stars) only to find out that it is one of the worst keyboards I've ever used. The keys are rather squeezed to make the keyboard more compact but that affects my overall productivity and several times a day I have connectivity issues which I've never experienced with other keyboards. There is a limit of 2 meters away from the computer that if I go over the keyboard will stop working. It is a very frustrating product and the fist Logitech product that I honestly hate.
customer_reviews.author: ILIYA

customer_reviews.title: Probably the worst keyboard I've every used.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time logitech user (mostly mice) and i'm a big fan of their Unifying Receiver; so I didn't hesitate to purchase this keyboard when my old one died. As I sit here typing the review, every keystroke is a chore. The keys are very wobbly, and almost have a domed feel to them even though they are flat on top. It has a very cheap feel to it overall. Obviously there are others on here that disagree and find it pleasant to type on, but for me it is the most awkward keyboard I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Gaige

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... opened the box, plugged in the USB receiver, put the batteries in the keyboard, flipped the switch on, and am typing without issue. Initially I had issues finding a good affordable wireless keyboard that didn't also come with a mouse (I already have a wireless trackball style mouse that I love). The keyboard works, and the price is right! As with any new keyboard it takes a little getting accustomed to, and takes a little more pressure than I'm used to coming from a laptop keyboard - not an issue after spending some time using it. It's awesome being able to close the laptop on the docking station when I'm in the office!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rigamer

customer_reviews.title: Description not accurate.. not compatible with Logitech Unifying Receiver...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this item 5 stars. Considering the value. However, Amazon describes this unit as having a Logitech Unifying Receiver. But, that is not true. It has a standard USB receiver. When trying to pair the items with a Unifying Receiver, it says that these products are not compatible. Had to return it, and get a K360 standalone keyboard that is compatible with the Logitech Unifying Receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G.

customer_reviews.title: logitec keyboard/mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: Got first one in Oct. '19. Around Mar.-Apr. '20 the board & mouse began to malfunction. They would not react to input. After some back & forth Logitech sent a new set. Here we are again....same problem. I'm tired of screwing around with this junk. And they weren't the cheapest available either. Money down the drain. Buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin R. Werchan

customer_reviews.title: Great KB for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I honestly haven;t been able to find a better keyboard for this price, don't let its price fool you, despite it being wireless, I've been using this for competitive play in Rainbow Six Siege. Works flawlessly specially if you use an extender to have the receiver in front of your monitor. And I love the small size of it, the only reason I had stopped using it was because of my own fault of spilling coffee on it, if you're not on that level of clumsy this KB should last you a long time , only bad thing is its a finger print magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Imperial

customer_reviews.title: Yes.  This is the right keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched. I did what some of you are doing right now... looking, comparing, wondering if I'm going to like the connectivity, battery life, key feel, everything... I weighed my options, hemmed and hawed... and then I bought this. And I am so happy I did. This is the best wireless keyboard I've ever used. Reason? It works. All the time. With no delays, connectivity issues, weird key feel or anything to detract from performance. I like the way it operates. I also really like how it pairs with the Logitech M705 mouse. Stop wondering what you should buy and just go for this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Simple

customer_reviews.title: Slim space saving keyboard without sacrificing function
customer_reviews.text: So, i was coming from laptops (which is all i've had for the last 8 years or so) and got a super fast desktop computer which i adore but i was so used to the laptop keyboards that i wanted a wireless keyboard that had the same feel and didn't want to have to have two separate usb receivers (i already had a logitech mouse) so i bought this combo (because 1 receiver for both devices). I do not regret my purchase at all, it functions on every level and i sacrificed nothing while saving a little space on my desk while i was at it! It was a win at every level!
customer_reviews.author: Candy H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with other logitech wireless devices - Beware
customer_reviews.text: Good example of the influx of cheap electronics from big countries in the far east. This big company released an inferior product with similar brand names but not the same functionality. I bought this to use with my higher quality logitech mouse. But the receivers are different. And since I don't have many usb slots, I'm regulated to use the mouse it came with. Time will tell how this works out on the product itself. Don't know why logitech would release a product that doesn't work with the other logitech wireless products.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bertin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've been battling this crappy keyboard for a week and I'm done. Intermittently drops the connection, then reconnects and types gibberish. Also hate the condensed layout with the cursor keys on the bottom and the home/end/page up/page down keys at the top, but that's my fault for not noticing when I ordered it. I'd send it back but already tossed the box because what could go wrong with a keyboard, right? Luckily this thing only cost around $19 so I won't feel too bad tossing it in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: My son helped us set this up so we could use the computer from sitting across the room, seeing what we looked up on our big screen TV. Works great for surfing, Netflicks, Amazon to watch movies on, etc. Don't have to get up and be at the computer where the keyboard and the wired mouse is this way. Have two now, can choose. He liked the volume control on the keyboard, this why we bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGirl

customer_reviews.title: works ok, might replace it soon
customer_reviews.text: i bought it to match my work and play computer keyboards, i dont like typing on 2 different boards if i can help it. arrived with a couple small dents in the top right corner but it works fine so whatever. after a couple months it seems like it cuts out on me sometimes. i might upgrade to some higher quality, non logitec units in the near future but for now their fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you expect it to work with other "unifying" Logitech Products!
customer_reviews.text: Same model number as a similar "unifying" keyboard I own. Product description says it's "unifying." BUT IT DOESN'T WORK WITH OTHER LOGITECH UNIFYING PRODUCTS!!! Found this out ninety days after purchase when I tried to use it at work with other unifying products. This is at least an oversight in their sales information, or possibly deception. I feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Restoration Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard~
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless keyboard that I could use on my lap. After reviewing several options I decided to go with this Logitech K360, and I am very happy with my purchase. The keyboard is smaller than the one that came with my desktop computer, which is a plus. It is also thinner than my original keyboard. I really like the power button that prevents the batteries from being drained when not in use. I have to say I was a bit disappointed that it did not come with a mouse; however, I should have read the description more carefully as it clearly states it there. Overall, I would recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Poodle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use wit my laptop as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the size, BUT IT IS ACTUALLY SLIGHTLY LARGER THAN MY LAPTOP KEYOARD. Only thing I will actually miss is numlock light. OTHERWISE ALL IS GOOD. ONE thing. When you are ready to use it, cycle the power switch. The keyboard switch. Also check the orientation of the batteries. Mine were backwards, BUT when I checked I foun that the positive connector can NOTmake contact with the positive pole of the battery compartment. I don' don't reaky type anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shankie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: This is my everyday use keyboard at home and at work. I bought two and use one in each place. It works great. I have become used to the shallower key travel normal on today's laptops. This keyboard shares that feature. I bought this a few months ago and have yet to need to change the batteries. I've had more expensive keyboards that did not work as well. Key travel is a important feature. The deep travel that is normal for older computer keyboards is now very annoying to use as I've worked on laptops for over 15 years as a primary computer.
customer_reviews.author: Chehalin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard for everyday working use.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this keyboard for over four years and it hasn’t let me down. Used it every single day for 8 hours at my job since September 2015. Writing this as of November 2019. Only had to change the batteries once so far. Can’t go wrong with Logitech, IMO. Only bad thing I have experienced is the “w” key sometimes doesn’t press down all the way, but with how well this keyboard has held up in all other aspects, I think it still deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hasselman

customer_reviews.title: New out of the box - WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today, so this is a first impression review-only. I will update it in a couple weeks. It is a solid keyboard, not flimsy as the last one, JETech, I purchased 3 months ago. Although, they aren't really like comparing apples to apples. I like the layout with the numbers on the right. The buttons are quiet and equal in size and comfort to those that are on my laptop. Not using the mouse that came with this keyboard as I have another Logitech wireless mouse that I am fond of. I will keep the one that came with this keyboard as a backup. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied buyer!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and in perfect, new condition. I contacted seller due to product not working and received the replacement three days later (due to a weekend day) with no questions asked. HOWEVER~I believe it could have been user error and the original is in working condition. I helped with the "install" of the replacement and it works perfectly! Quiet key type, small keyboard, but is comfortable to use. Same layout as my 13" Windows Lenovo Yoga (but this has the 10 key on the side of course). Do not doubt your purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kaybee

customer_reviews.title: what an awesome keyboard for those of us who are all about quality basics
customer_reviews.text: I could almost swear this keyboard was made for me, lol. It's slim and compact without feeling lightweight and cheap. Excellent quality grips on the bottom, but also sits well in the lap. Well thought out multimedia keys, as well as a well thought out layout overall. Keys are quiet but not *too* quiet. Everything is well sized and well spaced. Perfect keyboard for a keyboard warrior, i.e. those of us who tend to spend our lives typing 90 something words a minute in all kinds of crazy positions. This paired up with a M510 laser mouse and you'll be in heaven, ready to do business, anywhere, any time! :D
customer_reviews.author: J McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: it fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm a regular user of Logitech products and I gotta say the buttons on this thing feel really nice. When you get it make sure that you go to Logitech's website and download the Firmware Update Tool and Setpoint because Logitech Options does not work with this keyboard and make sure that you also download the Unifying receiver tool too
customer_reviews.author: QM44

customer_reviews.title: Not the original K360 keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have the original K360. In fact, I'm still using it and have been since like 2011. In fact, I'm typing on it right now. It's great. Build quality is good and it's compatible with the Unifying adapters. Even works fairly well for light gaming. This is NOT the same keyboard. The build material is not even close and no unifying support. I wish I had my money back. The mouse it comes with is super tiny and feels cheap. I guess it will get the job done, but I'm not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Butler

customer_reviews.title: great customer service BUT terrible product
customer_reviews.text: had some serious connection issues after a month. Keyboard stopped responding completely for a couple of minutes. turned out I had received a defective product. Logitech was kind enough to send me a replacement. great customer service. buttons have a hard feel, I don't like that very much but still works for me. it also comes with Duracell batteries, which is also a very nice gesture from Logitech. I experienced same connection issue a few months after I received the replacement. I guess this is one of those products that just stop working right after warranty expires.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wireless keyboard and I love being able to be at least 10' to 15' feet away from my computer and not tied to a cable . Everything seems to work fine other than you have to be pointing the keyboard in the general direction of the computer for it to receive the signal and I'm o.k. with that . It's approximately 1-1/2 to 2 inches shorter than a regular keyboard which has no bearing on it's functionality . All in All , I would recommend this keyboard to a friend , family member or any one else looking to buy a wireless keyboard on a budget .
customer_reviews.author: I'mjustsay'n

customer_reviews.title: Defective Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Logitech keyboard and mouse set on amazon because my previous one (exact same one) had a kick stand break off. I bought this on amazon because it was cheaper than where we purchase our office supplies. I received a defective one. I have to turn my keyboard off for 10 seconds multiple times a day to keep it working. About 50% of the time, it does not respond or type anything until I turn off the keyboard and then turn it back on. It is very frustrating. I didn't have this issue with my last set, which is why I believe it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Teddie A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is one helluva portable keyboard with the numeric pad you can have for the price. I use this for the portable solution (bedroom setup for the pc while lying on the bed) and I found the range is pretty good with minimal latency, connect to the pc right away and I bought it from here about a year and half ago and the batteries are still good (i do not always turn it off). Although it's almost 2018 and everything is going for dongleless; if you prefer a compact set of keys with numpad, just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Saad A.

customer_reviews.title: Best simple slim wireless keyboard out there.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing the JellyComb wireless keyboard and having a miserable disappointing experience, I ordered this. I really should have ordered this one first instead of bothering taking a chance on a brand with no history. This keyboard is just perfect. Does what it should, consistently. Long battery life, works seconds after you take it out of the box. Comes with batteries already installed, you just have to remove a plastic pull tag and you're good to go. Worth twice the money I spent. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaVTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I'm building a computer so ordered this based on the reviews. Just opened up all my boxes after putting my computer together and realized that this keyboard is already used, dirty and broken! One of the feet are missing, it's all scratched up and there is hair and crumbs all in between the keys. Absolutely disgusting and very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last too long
customer_reviews.text: I just got this combo a couple months ago. Two days ago the mouse started double- and triple-clicking by itself. Changing the battery did not help. It's not worth trying to claim the warranty for something so cheap..but it IS cheap - cheaply made! I have typically had good luck with Logitech products, but will never buy this combo again. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BobBoylston

customer_reviews.title: Good, durable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a year now. Spilled water over it,. Spilled coffee over it. Keys would feel sticky, but would go back to normal after awhile. What I want to know is how I can open it up to clean the spill on the inside? I can do without the shiny plastic as it's a fingerprint magnet. Otherwise keyboard has been totally reliable and never dropped connection.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the lack of performance I experienced.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it said it was especially designed to avoid interference, but I had constant issues of lagging keystrokes. I was lucky if 75% of the keystrokes registered and it was completely useless in any game where movement is achieved from holding a keyboard key. I tried several times to eliminate any signal interference and even tried being just a foot from the receiver and results were always the same so either its very sensitive to any interference or just a really terrible keyboard in its own rite.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is better as well as far less expensive than most of its competition.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a large keyboard, but I still wanted a numeric keypad. This one had excellent reviews so I took a chance and ordered it. It is exactly what I was looking for and I couldn't be more please. They keys when depressed do not click but there is positive feedback that it has been fully depressed; something I missed in other "run-of-the-mill" keyboards. I built my very first computer (including its keyboard) way back when I retired from the Navy back in early 1978 and have been using them (for my hobbies and as a system's engineer) ever since, and this particular keyboard, even though it was relatively cheap, "stands tall" with the competition.
customer_reviews.author: NV7SY

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I thought this keyboard would have a smaller footprint, but it is oddly large even without the extra keys of a fully keyboard. The buttons are unusually thick and stand up off the keyboard quite a bit while having a larger than normal gap between the keys. Maybe this is meant for someone with larger hands, but it will take some getting used to. The mouse on the other hand is extremely light, feels very cheap, and is small. A little disappointed with logitech on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuits

customer_reviews.title: Two pieces of hardware. ONE Reciever.
customer_reviews.text: The set came with ONE receiver. Smaller sized keyboard but does have the 10-key. Slim lightweight. Fits neatly in my computer bag. I have large hands and can use the keyboard and mouse comfortably all day. Low power consumption on both devices. The set arrived with batteries for both keyboard and mouse which was a nice surprise. I have 4 students in the house if they ask for a keyboard and or mouse this what they will be receiving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Keyboard is flakey
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard starts and stops at will - it's will, not mine. I find myself typing and see nothing happening on the screen. Had to switch back to wired keyboard. The mouse still works .
customer_reviews.author: C. Castell

customer_reviews.title: Mac Software Available, But Don't Search by Model
customer_reviews.text: Logitech doesn't provide specific Mac software for this keyboard, so if you try a Google search using the model number or go to the keyboad's page, it won't provide any downloads. Instead, if you visit their main Downloads page, it'll offer you their general software. It'll give you the ability to customize its functions. I typically make the Alt key like the command key on a Mac keyboard so I don't have to switch between shortcut methods. My husband has a PC and it works great for his. We switch back and forth. We use this at home, so we aren't heavy users.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Sumrall

customer_reviews.title: USB transmitter/receiver not included
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. This is the third one of these I've purchased. The other two were fine, but this one came without the USB device and neither the mouse nor the keyboard would work with the USB device (same model) that I already owned. To top it off, Amazon wanted to have UPS pick up the old junk from my house, which would have required me to wait around a whole afternoon for UPS.
customer_reviews.author: footloose

customer_reviews.title: Not very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used it for couple of times since Jan of 2019. This morning I was working from home and they receiver stopped working. When I plug it in, windows cannot start the device, error code 43. Tried on another machine same error. Reinstalled drivers etc whole 9 yards , no luck very disappointed Amazon gave me the voucher for the price of keyboard, but I will loose my shipping and taxes paid
customer_reviews.author: ahmer zaidi

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a couple of days and noticed an intermittent issue with the keyboard when typing, Also the mouse would jump around a bit as well. So I put in new batteries into both the keyboard and mouse but still had problems. So I moved the receiver/dongle to one of the USB ports on the front of my tower and now both keyboard and mouse appear to be working fine. This computer is only a week old so I think the issue seems to be with the keyboard mouse combo. Will update later if any more issues come up.
customer_reviews.author: AzTom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Transaction
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is perfect for me. The lettering on all of my Microsoft split keyboards wears off very quickly; this one has held up well; there's only one letter ("E") that is losing its paint. I like the functionality, and use the sound keys constantly. I have not had to change the batteries on it ever, whereas I change the batteries in my wireless mouse every 2-3 weeks. I bought it in December, 2015; today is October 2018, and I use the keyboard heavily every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kibi

customer_reviews.title: extremely annoying! (first I thought it was my computer
customer_reviews.text: I thought the batteries were dead after 2 days of usage, because it wasn't working (it was chopping my writing, sending random bursts of 2 or 3 keys at a time and missing 2 or 3... extremely annoying! (first I thought it was my computer, then the software, then realized it was the keyboard!)... so replaced batteries and worked fine, for another day only!! so, before putting it back in it's box for a return, I put the receiver in the front of my desktop and it worked fine (previously it was on one of the USB connectors on the back).. so apparently, you can't be more than half meter away to work.... it's been working so far (for today)
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: I'm more pickey than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize just how picky I am about my keyboard until I used this one. I set up a home office and wanted an external keyboard. My husband recommended this brand and the few things i am disappointed with are - the keys are quite small. Smaller than my laptop. They are also raised higher than laptop keys making them harder to type quickly. I also don't like the texture on the keys, I wish they were smooth. I also need a wrist rest it's awkward to type without resting my hands, makes my hands tired. Maybe my husband will use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda RasmusonTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: After a couple years of fighting, I'm giving up on Bluetooth keyboards. I've had several, including some pretty pricey ones, fail in various ways. Devices I've used with a "Unifying" receiver have always been pretty solid, and I'm using a "Performance MX" mouse already, so this purchase made sense. So far it's worked out well. Currently I use it for a Mac Mini attached to a TV - it's about a 10 foot separation. Sometimes the mouse has a little trouble, and I have to reposition, but the keyboard seems to always work. The "feel" of the keys is a little mushy, but that also means they're quiet. I'm overall quite pleased with this relatively cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good. Durable. Now have two have used the older one for 4-5 years
customer_reviews.text: These get a lot of use, but their batteries last a LONG time, a couple of years on my older one. I've come to prefer Logitech keyboards and mice for their dependability and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Buy the original version
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a big fan of the original k360, but this newer version really does not compare to the original. The biggest problem is that the keys stick and often don't press down. This is the 2nd one I recieved and both do the same thing. The original version (not this version) had the unifying usb dongle, so i could use it with any of my computers or other logitech products, but this one doesn't, just uses some cheap receiver that isn't compatible with anything else. the minor problems are that they changed the color and cheapened the whole thing. you can tell you have the cheap one becuase they have their brand new logo on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad of Bay Area

customer_reviews.title: Good size, good mouse, terrible keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard seems well built. Convenient size and not too large however it lags when typing and sometimes wont respond at all. Batteries have been changed multiple times yet it is still unresponsive. Super frustrating when trying to type an email and keys do t respond or type extra letters. Poor quality for a logitech
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey G. Vallee

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard - Compact, easy to use, easy to setup and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works great. The keys are spaced so you can type comfortably but compact enough to be a compact keyboard. The Unifying feature of Logitech is a plus, you can use Logitech devices (Unifying ready) with one dongle, I have also used this keyboard with another brand of mouse (using a different dongle) and had work flawlessly. Also the fact that has a numeric keyboard makes it very useful. Batteries last long. Have not changed them since I bought it. The keyboard is very responsive and keys are soft, easy to type on. Simple Setup, I do recommend installing Logitech's software (also very easy to use).
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard really makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: I'd had my old keyboard for so long, it seemed like I was typing on a papyrus. Logitech's K360 wireless is a massive upgrade. I love it: *great price! *the design is sleek and modern! *the keys are a pleasure to type on! *not having to worry about a cumbersome wire is incredibly liberating! We often take keyboards for granted and it's hard to realize sometimes how much we use them and how much a good one can really make a difference. If you're in the market for an affordable modern keyboard, Logitech's K360 is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Abner RosenweigTop Contributor: Writing

customer_reviews.title: It is not a completely full size keyboard but you'd never know it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. I like how it is compact with full size keyboard features like a number pad. I've been using it for years and never had a problem. I may have replaced the batteries once, but that is it. I love logitech products. Paired with my old logitech m705 mouse, its a great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Shope

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it sure is a keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's not quite what I hoped, but it's serviceable. My biggest gripe with this keyboard is that its key feel is pretty stiff, and at first it felt like I had to slam the keys really hard to type. But it works-- I plugged it in and it immediately started working, including its bonus volume control and function keys. Be aware that print screen is a Function stuck on the Home button on this keyboard; if that's something you're using often you may want to reconsider. Other than that: I've gotten used to the feel of this keyboard after using it for a while, and it's all right. No random disconnections so far.
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: 10 esc's outta 10
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard hands down!! I'm typing this on the older black key on white face, and action is fantastic. Keyboard is solid too. A very nice soft touch for gaming also. The keys are separated by the face plate, and mistyping is much harder, and the keys do not tweak sideways. Has many programming buttons too. If you can find the older white with black keys, that is the best one, especially if you are a visual typist like me. High school typing was never my best class.
customer_reviews.author: Movieskinny

customer_reviews.title: Great compact style
customer_reviews.text: Always and forever my favorite keyboard. This combo is very sleek looking for your work desk. I enjoy the smaller size of this keyboard as it allows me to type much faster and more accurately. I was nervous about purchasing a refurbished model but I haven’t had any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chardeemacdennis

customer_reviews.title: I contacted the seller and they said they would swap it out for me but I kinda fell in love with the keyboard and decided to kee
customer_reviews.text: keypad and mouse was suppose to be Unifying set, but no orange symbol on either keyboard or mouse. I contacted the seller and they said they would swap it out for me but I kinda fell in love with the keyboard and decided to keep it anyway....Mouse on the other hand is ok. Keyboard is ultra compact, bouncy keys, tilts up and matted so your fingerprints don't show. I would love it if it was illuminated, but then again it was only $20. It's just a very pure simple design for a simple gal who prefers minimal everything.
customer_reviews.author: Browniegirl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard!!!! I'm using it with my Mac and Everything is working as expected. I have this keyboard configured as an Apple Keyboard with the switched command and options keys (You can do this in the settings/ keyboard/modifier keys/ and switch the last 2 options). I also have an old Mouse paired with my unifying receiver, this just meet all of my expectations. Keyboard itself feels good. Only thing I would change is the arrows position that is a little bit low.
customer_reviews.author: slinktalk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wireless keyboard/mouse combo at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard/mouse combo (the Logitech MK360) for almost 9 months now, and it has worked perfectly ever since I plugged it in. I never have any lag time or anything like that with either the mouse or the keyboard, even though I usually use the keyboard at least 2-3 feet from my laptop. I love some of the shortcut keys on the keyboard, especially the calculator button, as I use the calculator quite often so it's nice to be able to just hit a button and have it opened up. Other than that I can't think of much to say, they do exactly what they're supposed to do and they do it perfectly in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Extreme latency, bad layout
customer_reviews.text: Terribly unresponsive. Bought this for use with my media PC and even when used in very close proximity, latency is nearly a second. Ended up being faster to remote into my media PC and control it with a laptop. Keyboard layout is unlike most keyboards people would actually use for typing, which forces even experienced typists to glance at the keyboard constantly.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Absolute JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Works for 10 minutes, tops, before it stops dropping keys. As others have pointed out, this is some weird counterfeit keyboard that does NOT use Logitech's UNIFYING technology. It's JUNK. Amazon should not be selling it and you should definitely not be buying it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: This is crap !!!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start? First off, it took about a month to receive my new keyboard and mouse, first thing I noticed was the keyboard only worked when it wanted to. After I'd beat it on the table, yeah it might work. I'd send it back but again, a month or so to receive this thing from deep dark Cyn-na I figure... you're better off buying one from your local NaziMart, at least you can return it without waiting a month... Oh, I did mention it took a month to receive this piece of only works when it wants to keyboard and mouse.... don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Logitech went from the top to the bottom in reliability
customer_reviews.text: I had to drag out an old time hardwired keyboard to type this because, once AGAIN, Logitech fell flat on its miserable, incompetent face. This is the THIRD Logitech device in a row that I've bought that took a total dump on itself, I'm done with them. They once were the gold standard for input devices, but they've apparently traded that reputation in pursuit of fast bucks. They'll work great for a couple of months, then fail utterly. GOODBYE, Logitech. I'm off to find something RELIABLE.You can no longer be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Brown

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is OK however not one but BOTH of the collapsible legs broke within a year of gentle use. Also, i went to the manufacturers website to see if I could get replacement legs but they wanted $12 for the parts and shipping. Pretty crappy that they are seeking to skim some extra profit off the top from their own faulty and defective product. Now Im stuck having to prop this thing up on a stack of note pads if I want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, except for a sticking key...
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months of use my "b" key is sticking, which is a pain in the rear. (I was going to say butt, but the "b" key has to get dug free after each use. Same thing happened with my previous keyboard, except it was a different letter that time. I guess I'm going to have to budget for a new keyboard every few months if I want a wireless that's handy. Other than this irritating problem, I love everything else and would have given it 5 stars before this issue hit.
customer_reviews.author: SLKsr

customer_reviews.title: responsive and comfortable set
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard and mouse combo has been great so far (about 2 weeks). There's no delay when I type or backspace and no delay with the mouse either. Connectivity has been great. I don't know much about the battery life yet since I've had it a short time. I like that there is only one small unifying receiver for both the mouse and keyboard. You can store the receiver in the keyboard. This set isn't as stylish as some of the other keyboards out there, but for the price, this set works much better than prettier keyboards in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Logitech K360 Wireless USB Desktop Keyboard — Compact Full Keyboard, 3-Year Battery Life (Glossy Black)
product_meta.description: Style:Without MouseThe Logitech Wireless Keyboard K360 is beautifully convenient and conveniently compact thanks to its space-saving design, familiar layout, 3-year battery life, and Internet and media hot keys. System Requirements: Windows XP Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB port
feature_bullets: 20% SMALLER – The K360 wireless keyboard is 20% smaller than a full-size keyboard but provides all the functionality of its larger counterpart
3-YEAR BATTERY LIFE – Work for longer with the K360’s extensive battery life—you can work for up to 3 years on 2 AA batteries (included in the package)
PROGRAMMABLE HOTKEYS – Automate your frequent navigation paths using the programmable hotkeys, so you can access your favorite programs with the touch of a button

NO-LAG CONNECTION – The built-in 2.4GHz signal creates a disruption-free connection to your computer, which means you can work without delays when you’re typing. 10m or 33 feet range..128-BIT AES ENCRYPTION – Your keystrokes are protected using 128-bit encryption, so your information remains secure when working wirelessly
System requirements:Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars7,928 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
